## Introduction {background-image="/media/daim/bg_cubes_blue.png" background-opacity="0.6"}

* This is a template for the **DAIM - Images** course.
* Try to keep written information on a slide in **small**, **digestible** chunks.
* Use **bolding** to make the text **easier to parse.**

## Backgrounds {background-image="/media/daim/bg_cubes_blue.png" background-opacity="0.6"}

* Use the **red, green and blue** voxel backgrounds.
* These come in **left** and **right** orientations.
* They can be found in this directory: `/media/daim/bg_cubes*`

## 5-minute open discussion {background-image="/media/daim/question1.png" background-opacity="0.4"}

* Use these five-minute discussions to bring more **interactivity** to the seminars
* **Do not overuse** these.
    * Freddie is prone to doing this
* Please use the voxel question mark background

## When should I use intermediate title slide?{background-image="/media/daim/bg_cubes_red_right.png" background-opacity="0.4"}

* These should be used to seperate **logical parts** of the seminars
* This is shown in the curriculum by **indented blocks** of learning points.
* **Feel free to rearrange** these as appropriate
